answers.answer: Hi!I am not sure what is causing the pain here. Have you consulted your doctor yet?

Welcome to the Weight Loss & Dieting Community; we are so pleased to have you joining us and hope you will continue your journey here.There are many people who support a high protein, low carbohydrate diet, and I, too, have opted for that type of program.  However, I also eat fruits and vegetables in smaller quantities, thus providing my body with a nutritional balance.I am concerned that the diet you are describing is so restrictive that you may be denying your body of the nutritional benefits of fruits, vegetables, minerals and fiber.  In doing so, you may actually be harming yourself.May I suggest a few things for your consideration?Please consider eating a balanced diet, higher in protein and complex carbohydrates, but also inclusive of fruits, vegetables, healthy fats (olive oil, nuts) and low-fat dairy.  Secondly, you may want to consider seeing your physician for a checkup and some routine bloodwork, specifically a chem panel with electrolytes and blood sugar to check for diabetes.Once you have implemented this for a week or so, please consider implementing moderate exercise 3-4 times a week.  Since you have not been exercising, start slowly by walking and then gradually add some additional exercises (cardio, strength, stretching) to your regimen.Your muscles can waste away without proper nutrition and exercise.  I urge you to consider joining us here where you can gain more information and support as you lose weight and transition to a healthier lifestyle.Best wishes ..Ranae

I'm with Ranae, I'd suggest first that you talk to your dr and maybe get some blood work done.  Then remember that your body needs all the different food groups and without them all you could most likely be doing more harm than good.In addition, it's important to incorporate exercise into any attempt at better health.  I'm a great advocate of walking.  Start slowly and work up a bit each day, then add other types of exercise.Good luck and hope to see you here often.

I think some blood work may be in order.  YOu could be suffering from a low potassium or calcium level.  If too low it is very dangerous for your health.  Please check with your MD.  Hopefully you are taking a multivitamin.  Please let us know how you make out.

question: HI everyone..I am hoping someone can help shed some light on this for me...Recently i lost 38 lbs in about 3.5 months. I did this by eating clean ..so no salt or sodium, no preservatives, no sugar and no fat... strictly complex carbs and protein.I do not excersise yet... but need to in order to control the flabby issues... the problem i am having is every single muscle aches and alot of the times it hurts.. keeps me awake at night...can hardly move in the morning and only gets a little better during the day... is this some kind of reaction to my new eating habits...It feels like my muscles are deteriorating ... if this is even something you would be able to feel...I felt terrific up until about two weeks ago..now i feel terrible every day.Any ideas about this.. when i say hurt all over... its arms, legs, back, calves, neck..everythingShadeored
title: HURT ALL OVER
